name: Main Market (Harbor District)
role_in_state: Primary transshipment and provisioning hub for maritime trade
economy_niches: Import, storage and redistribution of ritual reagents
culture_adjustments: Merchant-guild ritual forms blended into everyday tide rites
More multilingual/commercial speech (loanwords from Island Creole)
Kinship tied to vessel-ownership rather than plots of land
Practical commodification of navigation lore (paid reef-chants, lead-node readers)
constraints: Quay-space fixed; vertical stacking and jetties limit expansion
Guild charters tightly regulate who may sell or store reagents
Ritual magic dependent on scarce imported reagents â€” supply-sensitive
notes: State's main node for imported ritual reagents and salt-forwarding
Informal credit via kin-boat liens and guild bills of exchange
